intro: Cremanthodium atroviolaceum, commonly known as the dark violet globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers are clustered in dense, globular inflorescences. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy species in its native habitat.
